Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a grey pottery jar, the fabric is pink in section and contains a number of small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as eight dbst (type of meat cut ?).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:26/518 The North Suburb, Large Estates, T.36.3.
Curator's comments: Frankfort & Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 2:23, pl. LVIII, fig.41.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393492) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393492)
